column4: I've got a router acting as a wireless point.  I've got an ubuntu box acting as a dhcp server.  I've forgotten the ip of the router and don't want to reset it.  Can I somehow figure it out externally?  I already did a traceroute 192.168.2.70 (where 70 if the ip of my android phone that's on the network) but it's only showing me one hop.
The lease for the router should be logged (assuming it's on dhcp).
You can also use nmap to discover unidentified devices.
